issue.title: Allow skipping of testcases that have have @expectedException annotation
Add support for [optional] operators in @requires and @extension annotations
issue.body:
This adds support for optional operators in both `@requires` for PHP and PHPUnit, as well as for `@extension`.

Default is `>=` and the `version_compare` has been negated to account for that (previously was `<`) â€” this is so that the error message
makes sense (`PHP >= 7.0.0 is required` vs `PHP < 7.0.0 is required`) without needed to juggle based on the operator.

I can add the ability to change the operators to words e.g.:
- `>` becomes `PHP 7.0.0 or older is not supported`
- `>=` becomes `PHP 7.0.0 or greater is required` 
- `<` becomes `PHP 7.0.0 or greater is not supported`
- `<=` becomes `PHP 7.0.0 or older is required`
- `=` and `==` becomes `PHP 7.0.0 is required`
- `!=` and `<>` becomes `PHP 7.0.0 is not supported`

Refs #1984

issue.title: Missing documentation for @requires comparison operators
issue.body:
The [documentation for the `@requires` annotation](https://phpunit.readthedocs.io/en/7.1/incomplete-and-skipped-tests.html#skipping-tests-using-requires) makes no mention of comparison operators.

Comparison operator support was added in PHPUnit 5.2. See https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/1984.
